Introduction to Esports
Module 1: Defining Esports

What Esports is Not

There are many misconceptions out there with regard to esports, one of which is that this sport is unstructured and individually focused. Another misconception is this is just an individual playing a video game.

On the contrary, organized esports programs provide a safe, competitive, and extra curricular environment that allows student-athletes the opportunity to build critical skill sets, explore vast career paths, and contribute to their school’s culture. Esports is organized, competitive gameplay between teams that has its own strict set of rules and guidelines. It is about teamwork, communication, strategic thinking, and leadership, similar to traditional sports…and then some.
